title: Ticket #2367: performance issue - n^2 fsync()ing algorithm in dedicated scheduler
description:
There are three issues here:

  1. The algorithm need not be n^2, could be n DEFERRED #2397
  2. DURABLE SetAttributeString could be NONDURABLE to avoid the fsync DONE: [26688]
  3. The dedicates scheduler battles the scheduler over the correct value for ATTR_SCHEDULER value because of a mismatch in ds_name and correct_scheduler DONE: [26687]

First, in the 7.6 timeframe, the following code was added to the DedicatedScheduler... 

commit 03c931773b7b3f6060f5e33e1896f602fc01a7f0
Author: gthain <gthain>
Date:   Thu Apr 20 19:43:16 2006 +0000

    make sure SCHEDULER attribute is set for all procs in a cluster of parallel jobs

diff --git a/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C b/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C
index 9586559..e301411 100644
--- a/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C
+++ b/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C
@@ -1981,8 +1981,14 @@ DedicatedScheduler::sortJobs( void )
                        // so put it in our array.
                (*verified_clusters)[next_cluster++] = cluster;

-                       // While we're at it, make sure ATTR_SCHEDULER is right
-               setScheduler( job );
+                       // While we're at it, make sure ATTR_SCHEDULER is right for all procs
+               ClassAd *jobIter = job;
+               int proc = 0;
+               do {
+                       setScheduler( jobIter );
+                       proc++;
+                       jobIter = GetJobAd(cluster, proc);
+               } while (jobIter != NULL);
        }

                // No matter what, we want to remove our old array and start
@@ -3776,9 +3782,10 @@ DedicatedScheduler::setScheduler( ClassAd* job_ad )
        if( ! job_ad->LookupInteger(ATTR_PROC_ID, proc) ) {
                return false;
        }
-       if( SetAttributeString(cluster, proc, ATTR_SCHEDULER,
-                                                  ds_name) < 0 ) {
-               return false;
+
+       while( SetAttributeString(cluster, proc, ATTR_SCHEDULER,
+                                                  ds_name) ==  0 ) {
+               proc++;
        }
        return true;
 }

The result is for every parallel job in the queue, SetAttributeString is called (n^2-n)/2 times.

Second, each SetAttributeString is DURABLE and results in an fsync, could be NONDURABLE.

Third, 

commit b7ab1748d7115ea16025baa09be2e47f3d2d26d8
Author: wright <wright>
Date:   Mon Apr 9 23:17:26 2001 +0000

    + Added dirtyJobQueue(), which allows parts of the schedd external to
      qmgmt.C to set the flag that says the queue is dirty.  This is
      useful when we do things to the in-memory version of job classads
      that we'd like to be truncated on shutdown, but that we don't need
      persistently logged immediately (eg fixing ATTR_USER on a
      reconfig'ed UID_DOMAIN).
    + Added code to InitJobQueue() to check for the ATTR_SCHEDULER
      attribute for MPI jobs and insert one if it's not there (just like
      we do for ATTR_USER).
    + Fixed the code in InitJobQueue() for adding ATTR_USER (and the new
      code for ATTR_SCHEDULER) so that we set the JobQueueDirty flag to
      true when we do it, so that the changes get truncated (persistently
      logged) on shutdown.

diff --git a/src/condor_schedd.V6/qmgmt.C b/src/condor_schedd.V6/qmgmt.C
index 2bd1ae0..39b398f 100644
...
+       sprintf( correct_scheduler, "DedicatedScheduler!%s", Name );
...

Disagrees with, 

commit 356bbf10564d9d3936a709a0f945c162f2e29967
Author: wright <wright>
Date:   Tue Apr 10 22:59:11 2001 +0000

    + Removed ds_scheduler and schedulerName(), since we just want to use
      ds_name and name() to set ATTR_SCHEDULER.
    + Cleaned up the initialization of ds_owner and ds_name: ds_name is
      now always "DedicatedScheduler@schedd.name", even if schedd.name
      contains an '@' sign itself.  If there's an '@' in the schedd name,
      ds_owner will be "DedicatedScheduler@everything_before_the_@", for
      example, "DedicatedScheduler@wright", if the schedd name is
      "wright@raven.cs.wisc.edu".

diff --git a/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C b/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.C
index ed27ccf..08117ca 100644
...
-       sprintf( buf, "DedicatedScheduler!%s", Name );
-       ds_scheduler = strnewp( buf );

+       sprintf( buf, "DedicatedScheduler@%s", Name );
+       ds_name = strnewp( buf );
...
remarks:
2011-Aug-09 11:01:31 by matt:
Greg, why did you make the setting of ATTR_SCHEDULER operate this way? It seems like only one loop, either in sortJobs or setScheduler, would be sufficient. There's a case where PU job {1.0, 1.1, 1.2} might have 1.1 removed, but neither loops appears to protect against that (I'm assuming it is invalid state to begin with). Can we reduce this code to a single loop that handles the error cases of when setting fails (likely to ignore anyway)?

2011-Aug-15 09:17:57 by gthain:
First, note this is looping over the "procs", not the ranks, and there is almost never more then 2 procs per parallel job.

2011-Aug-17 12:41:30 by matt:
Ok, the algorithm may iterate more than is necessary, but does not perform expensive operations on each iteration anymore. Given that the wisdom as to why the algorithm is doubly cautious has been lost and no time to fully validate -- let's defer the n^2 -> n for now.
